text: On tap at the Mill. Pours black with thin head and aroma of chocolate that features again on the palate with a bit of bitterness. Finish is short, sharp and dry.
On tap. Nera con ricca e densa schiuma persistente. Aroma di malto tostato, caffè, in bocca malto, corpo leggero, carbonazione bassa. Ottima stout!
Liquid is black as night, small head. Aroma of chocolate. Medium body, little bit carbonation. Taste bitter, with a hint of wood (?).

Colore opaco scuro, schiuma persistente. All olfatto note tostate, caffe e cioccolato. Al palato mediamente corposa, malto tostato, caffe, caramello. Nellinsieme una buona birra con un forte carattere come deve essere una stout.

From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours almost black, with moderate caffelatte head. Aroma is of burnt coffee and black chocolate. Body if flat and light. Taste is dominated by that bitter (non-hop-related) feeling of burnt coffee. Finish is relatively short, with some bitterness left.

Color negro oscuro, opaco, con capa de espuma amarronada de más de cuatros dedos de grosor (demasiada espuma [jabonosa] pero no tengo problema con ello). La puedes coger con cuchara. Carbonatación a tope. Se percibe una catarata de burbujas en sentido inverso. Aroma a café, malta tostada, algo de chocolate, lúpulo, y un ligero ahumado lejano. Sabor a café, malta tostada, chocolate, algo herbal... Muy completa y muy sabrosa. Una Dry Stout increíble, al nivel de la Kernel Dry Stout Chinook.

Bottle from Gulating, Vestkanten. Pours black with a red glow, big creamy beige head. Aroma is inviting, with toffee and chocolate. Taste is smooth malty, with delicious roasted malts, coffee and bitter liquorice at the utter finish, solid brew, impressive at the low abv.

20/IX/16 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - BB: 7/III/17, bottled: 7/II/16 (2016-1024) 
Clear deep brown beer, creamy beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very roasted, caramel, some dark chocolate, bit of band-aid, hazelnuts, sweet, some vanilla, orange peel. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bit sweet start, caramel, lots of chocolate, soft roast, pretty bitter. Aftertaste: very hoppy, bitter, slightly sourish, lots of coffee, hint of caramel, very roasted finish.

0,33l bottle at home bought at Etre Gourmet (big thanks Saeglopur). Bottled 07 March 2016. BB 07 March 2017. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells of licorice, raisins, coffee-grounds, light caramel, some milk chocolate. quite nice smell. light body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes ashy, bitter herbal, some licorice, coffee grounds, some roast, bitter chocolate, earthy, russian bread. finishes rather dry and medium bitter with notes of coffeee, bitter herbs and some ash notes. lovely beer, quite roasty / ashy bitter but I very much enjoy drinking this one.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a medium/large brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. It is damn tasty, especially for the low abv. So much roasted and overall malty flavour, it is simply insane.

Pours deep brown with huge brown head. Nose is leather and . Aromas are roasted malts, leather, coffee. Average carbonation, medium body. Long roasty and bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Aroma is strong roasted malt, coffee, notes of dark chocolate with a hint of dark fruits. Flavour is lightly sweet with a potent and long roasty dry bitter finish. Body is light to medium. A very fine heavily roasty and bitter Stout.
Bottle. Nice. Roasty, burnt, light smoke, little spicy, tiny bit of sweetness there in the background. Nice coffee bitterness. Dry.
Flaske. Svart farget med stor fyldig skumtopp. Moderat karbonert. Smaker røstet malt,sjokolade og kaffe. En fornøyelig stout på 4.1 %
330ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours dark brown, almost black, with a medium beige head. Very roasty and burnt aromas. Taste is similar, very dry, not much sweetness at all.

33cl bottle at home. Hazy dark brown with medium tan head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice bitterness with subtle sweet tones. Roasted malts, some pine, caramel, coffee and chocolate. Very good stout.

330 ml. bottle. Bottled 07MAR16. Dark brown, cough sryup hue, creamy tanned head. Great lacing. Nose is powdery mocha, grainy chocolate milk, faintly cheesy hops, coffee grounds, powdery, instant chocolate milk mix. Taste is quite bitter herbal, big charcoal & ashes streak running through it, very bitter coffee grounds, low cacao & toffee, thin, gainy faintl oat milk, bitter roast & more ashes, light cigarette ashes. Massively grainy body & dry, decent for a touch thin, very grainy low ABV stout that is so heavy (overly heavy for me) on ashes & burned dry very grainy grounds.
Bottle from De Hopduvel. Black colour, dark brown foam. Intense nose of coffee and roasted malts, some ashes. Bitter and dry. Complex and easy drinkable. Great stout.
Black beer, thick beige head. Smell is malt and dark chocolate. Flavour is really dry. Bitter malt, a touch of some dark chocolate. Some acidic hoppiness too.
How : tap Appearance : very dark brown, small to medium tanned head. Aroma : burnt caramel, coffee, vanilla, dark syrup and smoke. Palate : medium body, average to low carbonation.

330ml bottle. Pours dark brown to black with off white head and decent lacing.

Aroma is creamy, roasted coffee, mint, herbs and dried fruits.

Taste is quite bitter, dry, with ash in the background and a medium slightly chalky finish. Plenty of body for its strength.

Decent stout, particularly for its ABV, if a little unbalanced.

Bottle, july 19th 2015. Black body, medium light brown head. Aroma is mildly roasted with dark chocolate, espresso. Taste is pleasant sweet with a black malt bitterness, hints of licorice and a robust earth hoppiness. Dry and crisp finish.
33cl bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark color. Thin brown head. Medium bitterness. Body is medium. Finish is long and dry. Aroma is highly roasted, chocolate, cocoa, nuts, hops.
Bottle. Deep brown. Aroma is roasted and coffee. Not to complex aroma. Taste also includes dark chocolate and a nice dry bitter ending. Much taste for a 4.1 beer.

Bottle. Black beer with a good light brown coloured head. The aroma is lightly roasted with some mellow milkyness. The flavour is heavily roasted and coffee bean bitter. Overall a nice strongly flavoured stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beer Gonzo shop 30th April 2016 consumed at home in company of Lynn and Barry on Sunday 1st May 2016.   Pours black with a light beige head. Nice coffee aroma but interlaced with a good little punch of fresh green hops. More of the same in the mouth, fresh, a little smoke but hops and coffee with chocolate to a lesser extent the dominant features. I love this, not sure why I have not rated before as I must have had it umpteen times. Tastes move like a black session IPA to me, but regardless its V.good. A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov16 3.9

Aroma of chocolate, coffee, wood, licorice, cocoa and dried fruits. Almost black with a tan head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall a very nice Stout, a tiny bit on the thin side, but for the ABV it is really great.

Ongefilterd donkerbruin... Onderin het glas donker amberrood. Gist onderin de fles.... Dus rustig inschenken. Volle foamy cremekleurige schuimkraag...deze blijft heel lang. Hoppig aroma met fruitige tint en geroosterde/gebrande mout en koffietonen en ergens iets fruitigs. Aroma geeft veel hoop op wat goeds. Smaak is veel koffie, behoorlijk heftig. Choco, roasty en in begin zoet... Daarna een volle hopbitter die heel lang nablijft. In de nasmaak blijft ook iets gebrands/assig achter en droog. Medium body ....weinig koolzuur. Best een goede drystout... Zeker niet subtiel.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

33cl bottle at home from FirmaBier. Nose is tons of cocoa. Body is pitch black, head is big, creamy, brownish, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is cocoa, quinine. Light freshwater sweet, heavy bitter. Finish is forever lasting mostly hoppy also roasty heavy bitter, slightly salty, light watery sidetaste. Medium body, dry texture, average carbonation. Not that easy due to crazy heavy bitterness, very simple, interesting, nice one.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka rozlana8/6/15 (czyli miesac po terminie BB). Lekko przeswitujacy braz piwa z ladna, lekko kremowa piana. aromaty takie, jakich mozna sie spodziewac - kawa zbozowa, nieco czekolady (a moze raczej ciasta czekoladowego, brownie czy cus), niemalo palonosci, ciut sliwek i chleba w tle. W ustach powtorka aromatow, slodkawe i lekko kwaskowate, nisko wysycone... bardzo milo pijalne, przyswajalne, szybko znikajace, takie co to po wypiciu czlowiek sie dziwi, ze rozlewaja to w male a nie w duze butelki. Aha, "hint of smoke" to ja nie czuje. Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Svart med høyt vedvarende lys brunt skum. Lukter papp, jord, trevirke og salt lakris. Middels fyldig. Smaker kakaopulver, kaffe og salt lakris. Den salte smaken kommer veldig på slutten. Lit vel mye.

(Keg at Kittys, 20160302) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and nearly white. Aroma had burnt malts, ash and coffee. Palate was medium bodied and soft with medium carbonation. Flavours were pine, burnt malts, liquorice, coffee, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste had hops, burnt malts and bitterness. A very tasty hoppy stout.

Opaque black and subtle red color with a thick beige head that last. Nice intensity in the aroma with some toffee, chocolate and coffee. Medium body and a fine fresh carbonation. Ok balance between sweetness and bitterness. Semi dry texture. Coffee, toffee, mild roast, some smoked notes and some chocolate. Lovely complex ale at only 4,1%.[Bottle from Gulating in Arendal, Norway]
Tap@ Brewdog Helsinki. Pours almost black with a thin brown head. Strong coffee aroma, cocoa notes. Very dry. Coffee dominates flavor as well. Dry finish. Good body for this abv. Solid.
330ml, bottle-conditioned. Pours dark brown, with thick off-white head. Taste is bitter hop. Quite high bitterness. Mouthfeel: lengthy hop. Overall: Fully flavoured. Sweet initially, then dry..

Bottle from Gulating Lørenskog enjoyed at home
Pours dark brown, black in glas, massive tanned head. Smell of roast, dark malts, coffee, prunes, a hint of smoke. Moderate sweet, smoked wood, coffee. dark malts. Moderate bitter, smoky finish. Very nice stout
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Black with tan head. Chocolate milk, roast and light burnt notes. Sweet, dry, earth and ash finish. Overall: nice super dry finish.

330ml bottle from Eebria. 
Small off white head, good lacing. Dark brown-black body. Nose is coffee, milk chocolate, some smokiness, roasted nuts. Flavour is roasted nuts, coffee, slightly smoky finish, gentle bitter aftertaste. Medium carbonation, decent body. Good to have a low abv stout that holds up the flavour.
Dark brown, clear. Aroma: chocolate, cereal, roasty, also garlic. Medium to light body, dry. Long, roasty finish.

Nel bicchiere si presenta di colore ebano molto scuro, tendente al nero, con bei riflessi rubini. La schiuma è generosa, di colore cappuccino, cremosa e dalla lunga persistenza. Al naso predomina il cacao e il cioccolato fondente, su una buona base tostata. La carbonazione è vivace, sopra la media dello stile, con un corpo leggermente scarico. In bocca tanto tostato (caffè) con una lieve sentore di cioccolato fondente. Lamaro è ben presente, ma più che da luppolo è dato dai malti. La secchezza di questa stout lascia il palato molto pulito.
33cl bottle. Black with a thick brown airy head. Dry and roasted, coffee, bitter finish. Intense flavour for the abv. High carbonation. I dont crave for it but it is well made.

Tap @ Man in the Moon. Dark pour with a rich lacing beige head. Rosted notes in the aroma, coffee, dark syrup, rosted malt. Dry and crisp mouthfeel with some gentle bubbles. Rosted notes up front in taste, coffee beans, dark fruit and some sweet molasses in the finish.

Appearance is jet black, a very small beige head which leaves some lacing. Aroma- leather, chocolate, roast malt, caramel, espresso coffee. Yum. Taste- lots of roasted malt in this one. Burnt toffee, espresso, bitter, dark malts. Vague hint of liquorice. Mouthfeel is thin and a bit slick, not much carbonation. Even though the bottle wasnt the freshest this is still very good.

Close to black body with a very large, dense, creamy and rocky beige, very long-lived head that laces the glass excellently. Fairly strong aroma of roasted malt, coffee and hints of fruits. Quite strong flavour that follows the aroma, plus some dark berries and grapefruit in the moderate bitter finish. Light body, dry and moderate carbonation. A nice stout. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 9 months after bottling, from Gulating Arendal]
On tap at Big Als. Black colour with brown head. Smoked aroma. Smoked, roasted taste. Light to medium body.

September 14, 2014 - at Holborn Whippet; cask. Looks great - deep deep red, bubbly, with a tan/light brown creamy/foamy lasting head - very thick lacing too. Aroma more like an extra malty traditional mild; roast (coffee, some dark chocolate) - mineral character too (their water? I seem to remember other Buxton beers having a similar background bite to them), enough dry floral bitterness to be noticed. Taste follows, more chocolate and less coffee character - the mineral character deepens and sharpens in the taste - its a bit hard to ignore, really - it sticks around longer than anything else in the finish, and knocks the taste score down to 6/10. The mouthfeel is fairly thick, its airy and creamy, and the "mineral" thing makes it see pretty astringent, which doesnt really fit what this is aiming for, IMO - I really would rather have seen this as a milk/sweet stout - all the other elements were there .... "I wanna like it - but I dont"

Bottle at malamačka. Pours a dark, almost black color, topped with a small beige colored head. Strong roasty aroma, some coffee notes in there as well. Lightly sweet and mildy roasty taste, hint of bitterness. Roasty aftertaste. Nicely drinkable.

Lukt: Lakris og sjokolade.
Utseende: Mørk rødbrun farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Lakris og sjokolade.

Bottle. Aromas of coffee, roasted malt and smoke. Quiet a strong burnt taste, with some bitterness.
0.33 bottle at Punk Rock Holiday, Tolmin, Slovenia. Nice chocolate aroma, light coffee. Full taste, dry, creamy, coffee aroma. Dry finish, medium body. Great.

30.07.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big light brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is dry roasted, weeds, roasted grain, hay, paper, minerals, burnt caramel, plastics, ashes. Taste is sour-ish roasted, weeds, burnt grain, paper, minerals, ashes, sour coffee, bark, harsh grass. Medium bitterness, harsh burnt and watery mouthfeel. Meh!

Dark brown to black, tan medium strong creamy lasting head. Aroma is very nice, chocolate, coffee and strong roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet caramel and chocolate with dark chocolate, some coffee, hint of fruit and a medium+ roasted dry bitter finish and aftertaste with some burnt notes. Medium bodied, medium to light carbonation, creamy.

Pours black haze / clear colour with creamy tiny lught brown head.
Carbonation is visualy low.
Aroma have no notice of an alcohol, prevails notes of roasted barley and chocolate, with some hint of coffee.
Similar is flavor: without notice of an alcohol, but with firstly sweet hint of a dark chocolate and coffee, which led to dry bitter / sweet finish.
Malt sweetness is medium, hop bitterness also, body is soft/sticky.
Proper, actually very proper dry stout.

Draft @Pulp Pub. Pours off-white diminishing head, dark brown medium to full body. Excellent aromas of roasted coffee, burnt caramel, licorice, hints of vanilla, cherry, spicy at some point, even a bit smoky indeed. Average alcohol, good presence of hops, resin, dry fruits, bitter dry finish with some slight sourness as an aftertaste. Splendid dry stout, has nothing to do with the dry stouts Ive had in the past. Well done, Buxton!

On bottle from Gulating Ølutsalg Lørenskog, 33 cl bottle. Pitch black color, good offwhite foam. Medium aroma intensity; roasted aromas, coffee, malt and some dried fruit. Medium body & complexity. Quite solid bitterness, balances ok. Enjoyable

fles zwart met fijne schuimige bruine kraag. aroma is lekker, goede chocolade, stevig, volmoutig, vanille. Smaken komen in eerste instantie een stuk harder binnen dan het aroma, redelijk aan de bittere kant, veel droge koffie, chocolade, wat aan de dunne kant, geroosterde- gebrande mouten, matig zoet, maar zo behoorlijk koffie/moutige tonen, iets té, komt niet meer gebalanceerd binnen. matige body, laag co2, nee deze is niet zo bijzonder
Cask at Euston Tap, London. Black beige head. Roasted malt aroma with coffee, chocolate and tobacco. Light to medium bodied, mmedium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.

330 mml bottle tasted on the 19/05/2015. Deep brown colour with a medium bubbly head. Aroma of roasted malts and breads, caramel and toffee. Taste is medium sweet with chocolate and coffee mix. Next one please!

Bottle in the Buxton Tap House. Deep brown, almost black with a cream head. nice coffee aroma. the taste is bitter with dry coffee and black chocolate in the finish. A little thin in body, but a very good lower ABV stout.
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2016 Deep brown/black with a tan head... chocolate & coffee on the nose, and burnt, roasted flavours... chocolate, coffee... nice and dry with a balanced bitterness.
Nothing to add to the commercial description. This beer is absolutely perfect, maybe the best dry stout Ive ever tasted. A balance between the aromas and a neatness which dont let you indifferent.
Mooie bijna zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt koffie, chocolade, vanille, bitter, gebrand. Smaakt bitter, koffie, vanille. Goede koffiebittere afdronk.
Draught at The Beer Market, High St, Dublin. No notes on this one, just a score.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours almost black brown with tan head. 
Aroma roasted coffee, roasted malts, dark fruits, chocolate. 
Taste chocolate sweets, roasted coffee bitters, hint of smoke. 
Mouthfeel thin, bit dry. 
Wow! really tasty beer!

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a nonic glass. No "born on date."

Aroma - Black licorice, chocolate, dark bread, espresso. Faint smoke - dark fruit emerges as it warms. Very impressed. 

Appearance - Sticky mocha head. Deep, black color with some mahogany hues around the edges. 

Taste - Chocolate (initially milk then giving way to the darker persuasion), hints of smoke, finishing with dark roasted coffee. Burnt flavors linger prominently on the pallet. 

Palate - Supremely creamy, softy carbonated. Light bodied. Bone dry. 

Overall - Perhaps the best example of the style Ive ever tried.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown looking jet black in the glass. A creamy inch of tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and chocolate along with a sweet maltyness and hints of caramel. Taste is heavy roast and a bitter, burnt ashyness. Dry finish with lingering roasty notes. Loads of flavour for such a small beer! Mouthfeel is light and the co2 is just above soft.

(Buxton Rednik Stout) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 4.1%
Black coloured body, tall and thick, dark beige, creamy head. Very good retention, heavy lacing on the glass.
Aroma has some acidity in it at first, roasted malts, faint chocolate.
Taste of chocolate, hops, citrus. Quite some coffee in there. Very bitter, with long lasting bitterness on the aftertaste.
Medium body, soft carbonation.
Nice.

Bottle (33cl): Served in a shaker at roomtemperature:
Deep dark blackish brown. Yellow beige head.
Aromas of malt roast, some chocolate, light coffee, subtle (sweet) roast and a dark manure tint.
Flavour has some very nice and subtle coffee/coffee roast tones, well done. Other hints I pick up are some soft chocolate, malt roast and bitters. Not too difficult but quite tasty for a 4%ABV beer!
Aftertaste is a mix of roast, bitters, coffee roast, some cacoa/chocolate, dried leave toast and nutty toast with a subtle dryness.
Low carbo, light creamy but more watery mouthfeel and medium and watery bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Keg at PSBH, Manchester. Dark brown with a thin cap of tan bubbles. Aroma and taste are much the same. Flavours consist of cocoa, coffee beans and a brown sugar-like maltiness. For a relatively low ABV stout it packs in plenty of taste and the body is quite robust.
330ml bottle from Eebria. Pours deep brown with medium off-white head. Light liquorice & dark malt aroma, taste is balanced fruity dark malts, very easy drinking with some teasing coffee notes.
Bottle at Irreale, Madrid, 26.2.2015. Black with a beige head. Roasry, nutty aroma, bitter, iodine and hints of sour coffee taste. Carbonated, full-bodied, dry finish.

Bottle. Black, light tan head. Malty, huskey, roasty nose. Some chocolate, just a touch of sweet dark licorice. Nice flavour. Dark roasty, light mouthfeel, roasty ashy good weight on the flavours. Finishes dry, roasty ashy. Flavoursome, good stout. Lots of roast for the abv. Gets a bit thin though, but perfectly fine for a roasty evening snack.
Cask at Buxton Tap House, Buxton. Pours black with nice beige head. Roasted malts, bready, coffee, hint of chocolate. Bitter dry finish. Very good and easy drinkable.

Near black with a beige head. Aromas are roast coffee with blackberries and toffee. Yeasty with earthy notes and oak barrel. Gentle smokiness with burnt toast and some oiliness. Flavours are molasses with dark cherries and earthy roast coffee. Plummy with dark chocolate bitterness and pithy citrus rind. Very solid for its strength.

Cask at Buxton Brewery Tap House. Black colour with a creamy mocha head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, a bit of smokiness and sourness too. Taste is fruity at first, also roasted malt, coffee and bitter dark chocolate. Really smooth and full flavoured. Dry, roasted finish. Overall a nice dry stout.

On tap at Kick. Its a more or less black body, topped by a creamy dark beige head. Nice curtains. Theres a faint sour touch in the aroma. In a nice way, but I still wonder if its due to a long lasting keg or not. Roasted malts, coffee and some dark berries too. All a bit weak. Its full bodied and dry with a pleasant carbonation level. The flavor have roasted malts, coffee and quite a lot of bitterness. Lasting roasted finish where the coffee is more evident than in the aroma and initial flavor. Quite nice this one, although a bit one tracked. 150204
Cask at the Euston Tap. Pour is black, aroma is malty, sweet. Taste is thin, malty, toffee, coffee. Nice
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Black with light tan head. Aromas of roast, light dark chocolate. Tastes of bitter roast, licorice, dark chocolate. Medium body with a dry finish.
Very nice dry stout. Roast malt with creamy texture. Pours black with mocha head and lacing. Light bitter finish. Tap at Churchkey thanks to Gendv138.
UPDATED: JAN 9, 2016 On tap at the bath brew house. Deep back colour, with a thin tan head, aroma has burnt toffee, the taste a soft bitterness, creamy on the palate.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours almost black with a solid tan head. Aroma is standard dark malt combination of coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is moderate sweet, a bit sour, unexpectedly smooth. I was captivated by the aftertaste - long, lingering on the palate coffee, dark chocolate and roasted grain with gentle bitterness in the background. I am not an aficionado of dry stouts but I must admit that this one is really good and enjoyable.

Draught @ Gastropuben KICK Malt & Mat, Kristiansand
Pours reddish black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, earthy, caramel and hint of chalk. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel and chocolate finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

On tap @ Kick. Black body with a nice, stable beige head. Nice aroma with coffee, mocha and dry fruit. Flavor is medium sweet, dark malt, coffee, mocha and pleasant bitterness. There is also a hint of vegetables here, but not really disturbing. Medium body and average aftertaste. Nice session stout.
Pours dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Flavour is malts, coffee, nuts, dark chocolate, cocoa.
On tap at Kick. Black colour with a beige head. Aroma is smoked, roasted malt, coffee. Flavour is smoked, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate. Medium body. Nice and easy drinkable beer.

Bottle. Jet black with big, creamy, tan color head.
Aroma: Licorice, coffee, chocolate.
Taste: dry with low sourness and medium bitter finish. Flavor of bitter chocolate, herbs.
Very good drinkability, low carbonaiton, short finish. Good beer!
Draft. Dark maroon brown color, thick beige head with good retention. Aroma of roasty coffee, figs. Taste has creamy caffe macchiato, plums, punes. very nice.

Draft at Churchkey. Poured an almost pitch black color with a small tan head. Aroma was some coffee, lots of burnt character. Notes say dry erase, but that could have been an auto-correct issue. Flavor was nice and roasty. Dry finish. Easy to drink. Reminded me a bit of the Guinness Extra Stout.

Roasted malty aroma and taste, some caramel, coffee, chocolate, treacle, some dark fruits, very faint smoke into the dry finish.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a dark mahogany colour with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is malty, liqourice, light smoke light coffee. On cask at Cloisters. 
Appearance - opaque brown to black. Lovely fawn head.

Taste - more roasty and slightly smoky. Then the dark chocolate and cream comes through. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a dry malty finish. 
Overall - yep nice roasty stout.

Bottle @ home. Opaque pitch black color, small beige head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is malts, roasted malts, coffee roast lightly, a slight hint of smoke and lightly earthy. Taste malts, roasted malts, coffee roast and moderate to heavy bitter. Lingering roasty bitter aftertaste and again perhaps a slight hint of smoke. Medium body and average to medium carbonation. Nice, I like roasty beers.

Bottle at home from Beer Gonzo. 

Pours almost black with a tan head, roasted cocoa, slight malt and a hint of smoke, very nice and a tasty beer. Good stuff.

De color negro claro con una buena capa de cremosa espuma marrón con bastante consistencia.
Aroma a café molido y maltas torrefactas, con fondo de ceniza.
De cuerpo ligero y cremosa, con poca carbonatación.
En boca presencia del torrefacto y algo de ahumado. Final seco y un poco amargo.
Una muy buena stout para el poco alcohol que tiene.

Butelka 0.33L.
Wygląd: Czarne. Piana bezowa, średnioobfita, opada szybko, ładnie firankuje.
Aromat: Czekolada deserowa, kawa zbożowa, palone słody, lekko ziemista nuta chmielowa.
Smak: Mocno palone, jak na stout bardzo mocno nachmielone, ziemiste. Goryczka wysoka, głównie chmielowa.
Odczucie: Ciało niskie, wysycenie niskie, faktura kremowa.
Całość: Smakuje jak lekki black IPA przez duże nachmielenie.

33cl bottle from Mother Kellys. It pours a deep brown color with ruby edges and a small beige head. Aroma is intensely roasted with strong notes of cocoa powder and light citrus. Some light wood notes alongside burnt sugar. Taste is medium sweet medium roasty bitter upfront then turns into a citrusy tanginess. Very dry astringent finish. Overall, really tasty and pleasant to drink
Keg at Blackfriars. Black, medium light tan head. Roasted malt some levels get coffee. Lightish body, balanced bitterness. Hops are very light. Decent.
Cask at Hare and Billet, Blackheath. Black pour with a beige head. Raisin, chocolate and light smoke aroma. Flavours of coffee, chocolate and treacle toffee. Nice dry finish. Quite tasty.

Opaquely black with a small white head. Deep, thick, dry stout. Unsweet molasses smell. Metallic full bodied taste with a finish that is hoppy bitter rather than from the black malt. 

Rated by BrewTom

On tap at Il Birratrovo in Como
Roasted malts, some licorice, beautifully balanced beer

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2014 33cl bottle. Pours black with a beautiful beige head. Smells of roasted malts with licorice and milk chocolate notes. Taste is similar with some ground coffee. Nice bitterness, light carbonation, smooth mouthfeel.

@StoutandLager. Un Stout anglais dans toute sa splendeur qui offre un profil solide sur lorge grillé. 1 an dâge (Sept. 2013)  Nez fort aromatique que domine lorge grillé quasi brûlé, des céréales caramélisées, de la réglisse, et un houblon herbacé. Le maltage fortement torréfié développe un goût de cendre dans la bouche adouci par un petit sirupeux réglissé. Cest un corps sec et acre qui soffre aux papilles avec une fin assez acre. Ici tlamertume vient de cette association: brûlé + torréfié + réglisse + torréfié. Le houblonnage venant renforcé cette amérisation. Super léger à boire avec un bel équilibre en bouche. Un délice.

Dark ruby brown with frothy tan head. Roasty nose, light body, astringent burnt toasty, almost carbonised, with very little else. Too cold and gassy, probably some fruit and hop in there but hard to find.
330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique. Rating from 2013. Poured with a large creamy head of foam atop a dense black body. Full mouthfeel.
Black with a thick beige head. Aroma of burnt, roast malt, smoke, coffee, earthy hops. Taste is light sweet with a long bitter finish. Thin/medium oily texture, with low carbonation. Good.
Sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, viel Kaffee. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, sehr viel Kaffee, leicht bitter hopfig.

On tap at Buxton Tap House, pours black with a small tan head. Nose brings out light roasted malt, dry cocoa and oats. Flavour brings out lots of dry oats, bitter dry cocoa and roast. Weak, but well-balanced. Not the most exciting, but everything is balanced well. Good one.

Bottle from deeside drinks emporium. Pours an almost jet black with very minimal light caramel head. Aromas of fresh coffee, bread and stale smoke. Nice taste with hints of again coffee and dark chocolate. Nice.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark brown body under a fizzy one finger beige head that faded to a wispy film. The nose is nicely roasty and chocolaty with just a little light roast coffee. The flavor is a little on the thin side, but I guess thats Ok, it being a session strength beer. Some decent roast and burnt coffee on the finish. A little light bitterness to help balance things and keep the sweetness in check. Light bodied and very easy drinking with soft gentle carbonation. Pretty decent Stout, I think I could have a few of these guys.

Black pour under a thin light beige cap. Nice earthy chocolaty nose with a little bit if hazelnut. The flavor is initially sweet with a bit of cocoa and some light nutty esters, and finishes with a dry earthy bitterness thats still kinda quiet and lets the sweet-ish cocoa tones through.

Poured an opaque black with a slightly brown edge tint. Light tan bubbly head about 5mm thick retained poorly but laced OK. Aroma faintly of roast coffee, molasses, malt. Taste bitter roasted malt and slight coffee becoming less bitter as it warmed. Lighter body than I was expecting for a stout. Smooth with a bitter finish.

Aroma: toasted malts, coffee, chocolate. Appearance: black, big creamy beige head, Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters pushed back by toasted flavours, chocolate, espresso, getting dry in the long finish. Overall: great stout, fantastic aroma and palate. Pint at the Buxton Tap House, Buxton.

Bottle from the Red Squirrel Chesham Brewery Shop. Poured black, with a dense tan head. Aroma of molasses, grassy hops and treacle. Full, thick mouth feel. Initial flavours of black syrup, burnt sugar and dark malt. Finish was building, bitter hops, coffee and dry, roasted malt. Really full flavours for the comparatively low alcohol content.

330ml bottle. Ruby red glowing darkest brown colour with small, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige to tan head. Dark malty aroma has notes of mocha, cappuccino, a cautious smoky touch of bacon. Taste is dark malty with minimally bitter and sour-ish coffee notes, dry hints of dark chocolate; lasting, mildly bitter finish.

In bottle, labeled as Kinder Stout.
Pours a very nice dark brown (almost black) with a decent sized khaki head and good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma has light coffe and lots of cocoa. Its roasty & rich very mild yorguty lactic notes. Very inviting. 

The flavor is fantastically roasty, with a nice level of grain bitterness that never takes things over the edge. Its chocolaty in a sort of dark chocolate way. Its got a light smokiness & is basically dry. The dark fruit is very mild and works nicely with an even more buried tartness for a subtle fruity character. 

The palate is never thin at all & this passes as a nicely full bodied stout. 

Enjoyable on all accounts, how I long for a 4.1% abv stout of this character brewed in my neck of the woods.

From a 33cl bottle. Looks the part. "A deep brown-tinted black, with a thick creamy latte head". Agreed, totally. Aroma dominated by roast coffee, but that burnt edge is little less than "gentle" for me, but it has that lovely light silkiness in the mouth where some of that prune/plum fruit comes into play, providing a little juiciness in the middle. Very enjoyable drink.

Cask at CBC Clapham. Pours a dark brown/black with an off white head. Slightly meaty, foody aroma. Medium body, mild carbonation. Light teriyaki, a hint of smoke, soy, a little grapefruit, licorice... Nice enough. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from chester beer and wine, chester. Black beer with medium tan head and some lacing. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste is bitter coffee, sour roasted malts, charcoal and a little chocolate. Good stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Cask in CBC Clapham. Opaque very dark brown to black, thin off white to tan head. Nose is very rich with lots of roasted malt, burnt malt, charcoal, cold fresh black coffee. Tate is bitter roasted malt and black coffee, some charcoal, dark chocolate. Roasted flavours really dominating. Body is lighter than many stouts, quite watery, but very good.
Black, ruby glow at the edges, zero head; aroma is treacly, a bit solvent-like; taste is roast malt, dark chocolate, raisins; bitter; very smooth; a good stout which punches way above its weight.

Una stout come si deve,senza gran ricami è perfetta e leggerissima da bere nonostante la presenza abbastanza massiccia di malti tostati e un ricamo di caffè, con una punta di affumicato appena percettibile la rendono una classica stout per qualsiasi occasione,veramente buona

Nose is coffee, a little smoke, a little cream. Taste is strongly of burnt coffee, with smoke and a touch of cream leading to a very dry earthy finish. Mouthfeel is a little too thin. 

Its a very good example of an English stout, its just hard to get too excited about.

Black colour with a light beige head with medium duration and moderate lacework. Aroma is strong roasty notes with hints of ashes and black chocolate. Flavor is roasty, licorice, black chocolate and coffee beans are highly present. The final is a little bit watery with a dry mouthfeel.

Stern dark brown, decent beige head. Clean soft roast nos. Lightest tobacco, singed coffee and creamy bitterness. Very squeaky and oily mouthfeel with watery finish. Fair but not firm. Decent for its weight.
330ml bottle. pours very dark brown with dark head. aroma is of coffee and molasses. nice taste. thick and treacle like consistency. bitter finish. would have again.

Bottle from Berkeley Bowl - West. Pours very dark brown with no head. Aroma is treacle with coffee notes. Med body. Thins as the mild carbonation departs. Flavor is treacle, dark malt, a little coffee. There might be some smoky notes. Finishes a little earthy, and surprising dry, considering the treacle I thought I was experiencing. Has strong flavor for 4.1 ABV.
Bottle at home. Sweet chocolatey nose, dry bitter roast, sweet chocolate, hints of fruit.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2013 Buxton non delude mai... impressionante stout dal corpo deciso nonostante il basso grado alcolico.. fresca in bocca, amaro e caffettoso si mescolano molto bene.. al naso anche note di affumicato... molto buona..

As "Kinder Stout". Dark opaque brown color, small brownish head. Aroma has some vegetables, coffee beans and chocolate. Light bodied, creamy palate. Roasted malty, some hops. Light classic stout/porter.

(Bottle): Pours dark brown, tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, dark fruits. Sweet dark fruit flavours balanced with a bitter black coffee. Some roasted malt and chocolatey notes with a burnt finish. Nice stuff.

aroma malty grainy coffee chocolate
taste sweet then dry with coffee dark chocolate 
smooth thick with a dry long finish

Cask at Lady Greys, Newcastle. Pours dark brown, near black, with a big tan head. Big roasted aromas, coffee and plum jam. Taste has a good roasty bitterness, with some smoke coming through. Creamy texture and long finish. Very nice.

Pint on cask at the harp London. Dark brown colour with a loose light brown head. Aroma is c hop and twigs soft roast. Flavour is really more a black IPA. Plenty of american hop in the flavour. Soft non offensive roast malt. Really nice drinkable drop.

Bottle 33cl from Mondial. A dark beer with low head, almost nothing. Nose is on chocolate and caramel. Aroma is on dark chocolate creamy chocolate, easy drinkable, medium creamy body, nice finish just on chocolate with good duration, good stout, some smoked notes at the finish.

From 330 ml bottle. Pours a dense black with maybe a slight red highlight at the edge and a small tan head that dissipates almost completely. Aromas of cocoa nibs, coffee beans, burnt caramel and dark fruit (currants and raisins). Taste starts off with soft fruit like stewed plums before a firm roasted bitterness kicks in, bringing dark chocolate and black coffee notes. The bitterness slips away to a chocolatey finish. Light fruity aftertaste. Pretty darn good.

Bottle. Near black with a beige head. Aromas are roast coffee with blackberries and toffee. Yeasty with earthy notes and oak barrel. Gentle smokiness with burnt toast and some oiliness. Flavours are molasses with dark cherries and earthy roast coffee. Plummy with dark chocolate bitterness and pithy citrus rind. Very solid for its strength.

YNWA, Kolding, DK.
Bottled, 060713.
Black with off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt. Flavor with coffee and spices.

500ml bottle from the brewery. Possibly the last, as it seems 330mls are to become the standard. A stout that belies its strength. Good stuff, but I drank it too cold and didnt have the patience to let it come round!

looks and smells good. lightly roasted coffee and raisins.
slightly let down by a thinnish texture.

cask. north bar. leeds
Almost black with a thick creamy head. It has little taste and only a small roasted aroma, but its texture makes it more than drinkable.

Small brown head. Opaque black body. Perfumy vanilla cocoa aroma with roasty notes. Dry-sweet roasty coffee taste with earthy cocoa notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft, smooth mouthfeel. Dry resiny roasty coffee aftertaste with earthy vanilla notes. (0.5l bottle, from House of Trembling Madness, York.)
Black body, light brown head. Arom ahas chocolate, roasted malt, acidicity and ash. Flavour is harsh and fry, with lots of acid and coffee. Very nice.

Bottle Cotteridge Wines Brum. Quite why Ive never had this beer I dont know as I really like Buxton. I suppose its because Im a bit hit and miss on stouts. This is black with a lasting thin beige head. Aroma of choc and coffee and a lightness an agility, a delicateness about the mouthfeel before more mocha hits you on the end, with some hoppiness too. Its good. Full mouthfeel, full flavoured. Very decent, very likeable and like all Buxton Beers, just about as good as you get at that style. another winner. Good going guys.
Bottle. Black with a small head. Low carbonation and well bottled. Subtle presence of chocolate with some bitterness,An above average stout.
Pint on draught at the Nags Head in Reading. Black with bubbly head. Roasty, dry, a good stout but short of greatness. Sweet chocolate roast aroma. Leaves a bit too dry a taste in the mouth.

Bottle at Bishops Arms, Järntorget, Gothenburg. Almost black beer with a decent beige head. Coffee aroma, licorice, raisins, soot, biscuits, dark chocolate, some cocoa powder. Roasted chocolate flavor, coffee, cocoa, soot, some sweet fruits, some licorice.

Bottle @ Christers. Pours dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Flavor is malts, coffee, nuts, dark chocolate, cocoabeans. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation. 100613

Bottle. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, little coffee and a little liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, little coffee, medium sweet, little liquorice and medium bitter.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Almost black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 100613
Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, coffee, chocolate, nuts, caramel and hops.

Bottle at home.
Black colorued with a medium sized beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel, hay, dark chocolate, hops and pine needles.
Roasted flavour of caramel, hay and hops with notes of licorice and pine needles.
Roasted finish.
Gravity at Cambridge Beer Festival. Dark black with a thick head. Full roasty flavour, fruit cake, toast, raisin, hint treacle, roasty. Bitter finish. Not overpowering. Nice.
On tap at The Trappist. Pours near black with an attractive tan head and a smoky treacle aroma. There is a hearty smoked malt flavor that sticks to the palate and a dry finish.  Very toasty.
Aroma is malts, caramel/toffee and very slight vinous notes.   The flavor is coffee, roasted malts, chocolate and a bitter finish.
Cask-conditioned at the Barley Mow, bristol 29/4/2013. Near black with a slight, off-white head. Black coffee, a touch of plain chocolate, liquorice and a dry, toasty finish. Enjoyable.

500ml bottle courtesy of mr_h as Buxton Kinder Stout. Dark brown colour, not much head, lot of bubbles. Looks like Coca Cola. Light tar malt aroma. Roasted coffee malt flavour. Toasty aftertaste. A good stout.

Cask at the Magpie, near-black with a clingy mid-coarse beige head and aromas of bitter cocoa and a little coffee and plum. Rich and winey, yet dry and bitter with hints of smoke and liquorice. Gorgeous.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines;  murky dark brown pour with white head, roast malt aroma, coffee taste with caramel.

Nov 2012 - bottle of Kinder Stout.  Pours with a fizzy quickly dissipating head.  First impression of taste - nice stout.  Good mouthfeel.  Mild roasted barley and coffee flavours.  Very mild really, and not much to set it apart from other stouts.  Nice though, very drinkable.

500 ml bottle. As Buxton Kinder Stout. BB Sep 2013. (K-Citymarket) Jyväskylä, Finland.
Dark brown almost black colour with some red hue and small tan head. 
Roasted malt, hops, mild liquorice and some mild coffee notes in the aroma. The flavour is roasted and bitter malty with some hoppy bitterness and mild coffee and chocolate. Very roasted. Slightly watery.
Poured a deep brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of roast malt, burnt coffee grinds and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour as per the aroma, well balanced with a hint of liquorice.

Tap at Craft Beer Clerkenwell, 08/03/13 - as Rednik Stout.
Light black, very dark mahogony brown in the light, decent sized bubbly tan head that retains well.
Nose is roast malt, cardboard, tobacco, touch of liqourice.
Taste comprises roast malt, light coffee, molasses, shaving of dark chocolate, liqourice.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, smooth and creamy on the palate, excellent feel.
A decent enough stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Yes. Very nice. Buxton always do it. I gotta go this summer. Love that part of the world and my beery love would make it all the more enjoyable. Theres some mellow chocolate to this which is just perfect. A 4.1% bottle of loveliness. Smooth indeed. Shame I was feeling pretty shite when I poured it and after a few sips the missus joined me. I gave her a sample and she promptly drank the remainder. Stouts could become a more regular feature Im thinking.

Bottle. Very dark brown, average and fully diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, lots of roasted malt - light burnt malt, light coffee and faint hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and dryish flavor, roasted malt with light coffee, light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dry, lots of roasted malt - light burnt malt, light salty licorice, faint coffee and light hoppyness. Nice dry stout with roasted malt - could use more body.

Cask @ Caley, Edinburgh [190213]
Black, rich creamy tan head, good lacing
Aroma of soft roasted malts and some chocolate
Taste of quite rich creamy dark malts, soft roast, dark chcolate
Palate - thin to medium body, creamy texture. Finish as main flavour, nice soft bitter chocolate malt linger, richer texture in the finish, but gets more dry with some stronger roast on the tail.
Overall - Good flavour and body for a 4.1% stout - like the rich smooth finish with dryish cocoa left on the palate
500ml bottle. Fairly dry stout.The only taste I detect is smoke on the finish. Overall: not good.

Cask @ CBC Clerkenwell, smallish stable head, very dark brown colour, light aromatic coffee aroma with dark milk chocolate abd very light roasted notes, flavour of fudge and dark chocolate with some barnyard, pleasant medium bitterness. Nice and smooth.
Roasted malt, some coffee, ash and burnt toast. A bit thin of palate which is a shame, but a good beer nonetheless.
Cask at craft. Black with short lasting head. Biscuity aroma, slightly roasty, ashy, chocolate. Similar taste with a slight fruitiness. Light bodied. Very nice but could do with more weight.

500 ml bottle as Kinder Stout.
Pours a black colour with a small head. Aroma of roasted malts, tobacco and bread-like notes. Flavour of roasted malts, sweet dried fruits, salty licorice, ash and strong bitterness. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a roasty bitter finish with subtle saltiness. Pleasant.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 31/1/2013 Cask from The Ale House, Chelmsford. Looked the part, almost black with a little head, decent chocolate aroma, however I found this to be much too bitter and much too dry and this took away much of the enjoyment of this beer. 6443-8. Updated 17/2/2017. Cask at the Three Wise Monkeys, Colchester. Pours almost black with a small off-white head. Aroma of chocolate and malt. Moderate sweetness with medium plus bitterness. Medium body and slight oily texture. Carbonation is too highly carbonated. Better than last time but still not its greatest fan.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2013 Cask conditioned	handpump	Craft Beer Co	London.  A black beer with whitish bubbles for a head.  A smoky stout.  Malts appear smoked.  Very dry.  Burnt roastiness.  Lacking body but pretty tasty.  Score 3.5Subsequent rating also scored 3.5

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2013 21st January 2013Old Fountain. Opaque dark brown beer, small tan head. Palate is soft and airy. Not much carbonation but it has a nice mouthfeel. Mellow soft dark malt. Touch of sour dark chocolate and super mild coffee. Whisper of fruit underneath. Semi dry finish with a mild bitter aftertaste and tang. Nice soft stout.6th August 2011Cask at Southampton Arms as Kinder Stout. Very dark brown beer, little pale tan head. Light dry palate. Very light dark malt. Decent fruit in the undertone. Dry finish. A fruity but dry and inoffensive porter. 3.3

500ml bottle from K-Supermarket Kamppi
BBE SEP 2013 - 
Pours pitch black with a bubbly white head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee beans, roasted malts and hints of grainy malts. Taste is smooth, mildly roasty with hints of dark chocolate and coffee. Finish is slick with some roastiness and hints of coffee. Smooth, quite enjoyable session stout.

Cask at Hanging Bat. Deep brown/black, creamy beige head. Big Weetabix malts, oatmeal, slight cacao, definite coffee nose. Sweet creamy front, dark chocolate, mild roast, then a big bitter roast finish. Lovely rich body but just a tiny bit bitter for me.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2014 Bottle, shared with Andrew. Jet black body with a medium cream coloured head. Great lacing. Aroma of espresso, digestives and chocolate. Flavour of coffee, ash and chocolate. Light bitterness. Medium body with a smooth texture. Gentle carbonation. A solid, simple Stout.

Cask at Euston Tap, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, coffee aroma. Tastes roasty, malty, coffee, some chocolate. Decent stout. Earlier Rating: 10/13/2012 Total Score: 3.4Cask at Cask Pub and Kitchen, Pimlico, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Sweet malty, roasty, coffee aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, slight sweetness, coffe and chocolate. Nice stout.

Cask at very dark brown with a tiny off-white head. The nose is coffee, roasted malt, touch of liquorice, hint of smoke and some molasses. The taste is roasted malt, coffee, burnt earth, light treacle, charcoal and wood with a dry, roasty finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Decent.Earlier Rating: 10/11/2012 Total Score: 3.7Cask at CP&K. It pours deep ruby, with a medium beige head. The nose is roasted malt, ash, coffee, treacle, light smoke, toast, some soft fruit and biscuit. The taste is rich roasted malt, ash, charcoal, burnt earth, bitter chocolate, coffee grinds and treacle, with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. A robust, well-made stout.
0,5l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours very dark brown with a low off-white head. Weak aroma is roasted malts. Flavor is roasted malts with a hint of coffee and hops. A bit watery, but otherwise good.

Cask at the Euston Tap, London. Pours dark brown with a very creamy, tan cap. Moderate roast in the nose, a bit of burnt wood. Light to medium sweet flavor, bitter cocoa, good roast, wet earth, tar. Medium bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Earthy finish, soil, wet wood, ash tray, moderate roast, burnt sugars. Solid.Earlier Rating: 8/6/2011 Total Score: 3.8Cask at the Southampton Arms, London. Pours brown-black with a small, off-white head. Big roast aroma, some cocoa and dry coffee. Nice flavor, light to medium sweet, slight milk cocoa, bit of leafy bitters. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Semi-dry, semi-sweet finish, plenty of lingering roast. Great stuff.

(Cask at Southampton Arms, Kentish Town, London, 21 Nov 2012) Black colour with foamy, beige head. Roasted, malty nose with notes of coffee, cacao and dark chocolate. Malty, roasted taste with coffee, dark chocolate, cacao and a dry finish with a generous coffee bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Highly drinkable and very tasty. Very nice.

.5l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar
Pours black with low head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts. Some milk or lactose. Flavor is mostly same plus chocolate flavor and spices. Ok beer for this low abv.

Bottle. Date indeterminable. Penetrable ebony. Wispy, tiny-bubbled ring of foam. Seductive chocolate fudge, blackened toffee, and espresso malt aromatics swirled with dabs of charred wood, vanilla bean, carob, black licorice and dried plums. Fairly husky with some burnt popcorn exuding. Fine carbonation. Spirited clench of cottony roast merges with stiff char which leaves behind a trail of body-thinning acids and burnt cookie crumbs. Soft bready malt depth slowly blossoms as it soundly roots itself amid the sharper char, keeping the acids at relative bay. Ample sappiness from the oily hops helps with the softening effect. Heaping stacks of malty richness ranging from burnt toffee to fudge cake gain more detail as the bittersweet notions arise. Aggressively spicy and woody hop finish is bittersweet with bakers chocolate dribbled with reduced espresso oiliness atop a chocolate cake heftiness and unremitting char. Well, aside from the rampant huskiness in both the nose and flavor, this is very nicely constructed. Im quite tickled to see a circa 4% bottle-conditioned stout available in the States, which are woefully scarce here.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2013 50 cl bottle @ home as Kinder Stout, BBE 09/2013
Aroma has coffee and dark chocolate. Also some distant peaty and ashy notes. Flavour has coffee, some vegetable notes typical to mocha beer, very dark chocolate and distant metallic notes. Dry finish with rather strong coffee notes and very well roasted malt. The finish feels actually a bit unpleasant  perhaps due to hops, which could be less aggressive there. Very dry and very good stout for this ABV.

50 cl bottle at Bishops Arms Järntorget, on November 28, 2012. BB SEP 2013.Clear very dark red to black color, light brown head. Sweet, chocolate, juniper, cocoa scent. Sweet, roasted, dry, chalk, malty, bitter taste. Medium mouthfeel, dry medium bitterness.Very tasty and highly drinkable, Id love to try this draught or from cask too.

Cask conditioned at Far From the Madding Crowd. Black with cream head. There is a rich, fruity roastiness to this beer, chocolate and coffee hints with a late bitterness. A very decent stout and really drinkable, nothing like Kinder Scout which is a boggy morass but a clever name nevertheless.
Cask at Bon Accord, Glasgow - clear dark red brown, creamy tan head, dry malty aroma, flavour of smoky dry sherry, minimal hop, dry malty finish

Tasted from the bottle, bought @Buxton Brewery on 06/11/2012.
Looks just beautiful, in totally black color, with just a small creamy head.
Aroma is quite intense, notes of roasted&toasted barley malts dominate, could feel a bit of oats as well, also a hint of nuts and char.
Mouthfeel is lovely, just a tiny bit silky smooth and medium carbonated.
For a beer that has only 4% abv, taste is really complex, well balanced with aroma, roasted notes are the most distinct again, but also having a pleasant mix of charcoal, ashy and woody tones in it. 
That pallete feels delicious and quite harmonic.
After some warming up could feel a hint of dark chocolate in aroma as well.
Aftertaste is pleasant and long-lasting, with the notes of coal and toasted bread.
To conclude, there's nothing "kinder" except the abv level in this stout, very serious drink! With no doubt,
Recommended+

A colablack beer with a quite weak and beige head. Aroma is balanced, lots of chocolate, roastiness, some sweetness and coffee. Taste is strongly roasted, black coffee, some milky sourness, quite dry. Medium- bodied, smooth and almost velvety drinkability. Great chocolate aroma, that unfortunately not continued to the taste, that is mostly roasted. Overally, nicely smooth and enjoyable stout.

Cask @ CPK. The pours deep brown with a tiny tan head. The nose is lactose, sweet nuts, coffee creamer and milk chocolate. The taste is smooth chocolate syrup, more roasted nuts, whipped cream. Light coffee bitterness on the smooth finish. Velvety body, rounded edges. Overall, a very nice low abv stout. Well done.
